extendedInfo.description: This version REQUIRES root permissions. Other AnyConnect images are available without this requirement.This technical preview supports Android 2.2+ with root access. AnyConnect for Android 4.0+ devices is now available, identified as the "AnyConnect ICS" package.COMPATIBLE DEVICES: This release supports rooted Android 2.2+ devices. A compatible tun.ko module is required, which should be placed in /data/local/kernel_modules/ if the tun module is not built into the kernel. The iptables binary is also required.For those without root access, a fully supported production AnyConnect for platforms is available as a separate download from Google Play.We cannot guarantee compatibility, but look forward to your feedback.APPLICATION DESCRIPTION:AnyConnect provides reliable and easy-to-deploy encrypted network connectivity from devices by delivering persistent corporate access for users on the go. Whether providing access to business email, a virtual desktop session, or most other Android applications, AnyConnect enables business-critical application connectivity.LICENSING AND INFRASTRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS:AnyConnect for Android requires Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) Boot image 8.0(4) or later. For licensing questions and evaluation licenses, please contact ac-mobile-license-request (AT) cisco.com and include a copy of "show version" from your Cisco ASA. If you already have an Essentials or Premium ASA license, you may use the automated license request tool at:https://tools.cisco.com/SWIFT/Licensing/PrivateRegistrationServlet?FormId=717The ASA requires an AnyConnect Mobile license (L-ASA-AC-M-55XX=), as well as either an AnyConnect Essentials (L-ASA-AC-E-55XX=) or AnyConnect Premium Clientless SSL VPN Edition (L-ASA-AC-SSL-YYYY=) license, where XX is the last two digits of your ASA model number and YYYY is the number of simultaneous users. AnyConnect Mobile and Essentials licenses are enabled per ASA, there is no per user charge for either of these licenses.FEATURES:- Automatically adapts its tunneling to the most efficient method based on network constraints, using TLS and DTLS- DTLS provides an optimized network connection- IPsec/IKEv2- Network roaming capability allows connectivity to resume seamlessly after IP address change, loss of connectivity, or device standby- Wide range of authentication options- Supports certificate deployment using AnyConnect integrated SCEP and the certificate import URI handler- Policies can be configured locally, and automatically updated from the security gateway- Access to internal IPv4/IPv6 network resources- Administrator-controlled split / full tunneling network access policy- Trusted Network Detection- Localizes according to the device's language and region settingsSUPPORT:If you are an end-user and have any issues or concerns, please contact your organizationâs support department. If you are a System Administrator having difficulties configuring or utilizing the Application, please contact your designated support point of contact.We are unable to guarantee support for all devices.FEEDBACK:You can provide us with feedback by sending us a log bundle by navigating to "Menu > Diagnostics > Send Logs" and choose "Feedback to Cisco" with a description of the issue. Please read the Known Issues section prior to sending feedback.You can reach us on Twitter by directing a tweet to @AnyConnect, or by visiting our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/anyconnect.DOCUMENTATION:Release Notes: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/vpn_client/anyconnect/anyconnect30/release/notes/rn-ac3.0-android.htmlUser Guide: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/security/vpn_client/anyconnect/anyconnect30/user/xmart/b_Android_User_Guide.html

reviews.title: Crashing/Stopped
reviews.comment: when i try to import a certificate it crashes. using samsung galaxy s3 rooted.
reviews.author: neL johns

reviews.title: Still no group authentication
reviews.comment: It\'s been years now and this app still doesn\'t support group / secret code authentication, which any iOS device already includes. The company I work with uses Cisco vpn gateways and I just can\'t understand why Cisco won\'t support its own devices.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Failed to load.
reviews.comment: Rooted galaxy S4 (stock otherwise). Failed to start a required component, says a reboot may fix (didn\'t)
reviews.author: Tom Lentz

reviews.title: Broken on 4.3 still
reviews.comment: I have upgraded both my nexus 4 and my nexus 10 to 4.3 and now I get no DNS through AnyConnect for my VPN side clients.  Application worked perfect on 4.2.
reviews.author: Chris Robison

reviews.title: No ability to set vpn domains
reviews.comment: The stock android client allows for the setting of domains that are to be looked up over the vpn.  This client does not, and is therefore unusable for connections with my company\'s vpn.  The answer given below of \'the administrator has to configure it\' is not valid, as the stock android vpn client does this by default, so if it can do it, there\'s no valid reasoning as to why this client cannot.
reviews.author: Russell Long

reviews.title: Handy tool
reviews.comment: Easy installation and seems to work.
reviews.author: Jamie Alexander

reviews.title: Utter garbage
reviews.comment: Won\'t connect to their own rv082 vpn router with any of the auth protocols, no real support for ipsec with router despite claims.... rooted s3
reviews.author: Shayraz Ikram

reviews.title: fails to bind
reviews.comment: upon startup it just says  Error failed to bind to Vpnservice  and then quits
reviews.author: Pavel Heimlich

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work after firmware upgrade
reviews.comment: Cisco has been working with me on resolving this issue. I didn\'t even have to reach out to them first, they contacted me. 4 stars for the great support. Hopefully this issue will be resolved.
reviews.author: Alan Ryder

reviews.title: Connected but..!
reviews.comment: The rate is for un-rooted version.however, the rooted version successfully connected through vpn, but cannot browse corporate portal.  The un-rooted version successfully browsing the corporate portal.
reviews.author: Adel AL-jowhar

reviews.title: Insufficient storage avaible
reviews.comment: Right after downloading the new update I got an \"Insufficient storage\" error. FW: CM10.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works like a charm..
reviews.comment: Works like a charm only after I had tun.ko installed and updated. One of the top apps available :-)
reviews.author: Nikhil Kelkar

reviews.title: No group support
reviews.comment: And no indication in the documentation.  How hard is it to say up front,  \"Sorry no group support\"? Instead I install and struggle and uninstall.
reviews.author: Nathan Franzen

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work on Nexus 10
reviews.comment: Installed it. Initially would just crash with the error message \"VPN Service is shutting down because a critical component cannot be initialized. A reboot may fix the problem.\" Tried rebooting. Other rooted apps worked fine, and SuperSU was installed.  To get it to work, I had to re-root my device using Wug\'s Nexus Toolkit (even though it was already rooted). That seemed to fix the problem.  Using a rooted Galaxy Nexus 10 running Android 4.2.1 build JOP40D.
reviews.author: Daniel Thompson

reviews.title: VPN Works but... UPDATE:CRASHES!!!
reviews.comment: VPN Works great but as others said, constantly requesting su. Can\'t seem to stop this app from restarting which causes freezing and slows my device. Had to uninstall and everything is back to normal. Don\'t want to reinstall every time I need to use it. Please FIX it. Thank you...  ***Cisco responded and 3.x version fixed the issues. Love the App, upgraded to \'5\' stars. Thank you...  UPDATE: Started crashing at each boot and several times a day again. Expect more from Cisco..!
reviews.author: A Google User
